summary_reasoning: This report suffers from severely opaque assumptions that are scattered throughout without clear connection to forecasts. Key financial projections in the Financials Snapshot table (revenue growing from $6.1B to $8.4B, EPS jumping from $9.85 to $24.50) lack any explicit justification or derivation. The Fair Value section mentions '$685 per share' using '28x forward P/E on $24.50 EPS' but provides no basis for these critical inputs. WACC/discount rate assumptions are buried in appendix without justification. Most concerning, there are clear contradictions: the report claims 'net cash position of $3.8 billion' while simultaneously stating 'debt-to-equity ratio of 101.4%' - these cannot both be true. China revenue projections show internal inconsistency (16% decline vs 15% decline in different sections). No quantified sensitivity analysis exists for any material drivers despite significant uncertainties around China restrictions and Ansys integration. The assumptions fail all five quality pillars.

assumptions_extracted.quote: Revenue growth assumptions include 8-10% organic growth driven by AI tool adoption and IP expansion, plus Ansys contribution targeting combined entity revenue of $8+ billion by fiscal 2027
Operating margin expansion from current 21% toward 25% reflects scale benefits and $400 million cost synergies realization
28x forward price-to-earnings multiple to fiscal 2026 estimated earnings per share of $24.50
Normalized China revenue decline: 15% in FY2025, recovering 50% by FY2027

contradictions.description: Claims both 'net cash position of $3.8 billion' and 'debt-to-equity ratio of 101.4%' which cannot both be accurate
China revenue decline stated as both '16% year-over-year' and '15% in FY2025' in different sections
